intro: Luehea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered luehea, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds.
